title: Quinoa Kale Salad
directions: Rinse quinoa and cook it in water until tender.
Toss the cooked quinoa with chopped kale in a large bowl.
Add cherry tomatoes, red onion, lemon juice, and olive oil.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.

title: Avocado Toast with Smoked Salmon
directions: Toast the bread slices until golden.
Mash the avocado with lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Spread the avocado mixture evenly over the toast.
Layer smoked salmon on top and add capers or dill if desired.
Serve immediately.

title: Grilled Chicken & Veggie Bowl
ingredients: Salt, pepper, and herbs to taste
directions: Season the chicken breast with salt, pepper, and herbs.
Grill the chicken until fully cooked, then slice it.
Steam the broccoli, carrots, and bell peppers until tender.
Combine the sliced chicken and vegetables in a bowl.
Drizzle olive oil over the mixture and adjust seasonings.

title: Mediterranean Chickpea Salad
directions: Place the rinsed chickpeas in a large mixing bowl.
Add the diced cucumber, cherry tomatoes, black olives, and red onion.
Drizzle olive oil and red wine vinegar over the salad.
Toss gently to combine all the ingredients.
Season with salt and pepper and chill before serving.

title: Vegan Buddha Bowl
directions: Cook the quinoa according to package instructions.
Roast the sweet potato cubes and broccoli florets in the oven until tender.
In a bowl, combine quinoa, roasted vegetables, chickpeas, and mixed greens.
Drizzle with tahini and lemon juice dressing.
Season with salt and pepper and serve warm.

title: Zucchini Noodles with Pesto
directions: Spiralize the zucchinis to create noodles.
Blend basil leaves, pine nuts, olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper to make the pesto.
Toss the zucchini noodles with the prepared pesto sauce.
If desired, add cherry tomatoes for extra flavor.
Serve immediately.

title: Spicy Tofu Stir Fry
ingredients: 2 tbsp soy sauce (or tamari for gluten-free)
directions: Cube the tofu and pat dry with a paper towel.
Stir-fry the tofu in a pan until golden on all sides, then remove from the pan.
Sauté broccoli, red bell pepper, snap peas, and minced garlic in the same pan.
Return the tofu to the pan and add soy sauce, sriracha, and sesame oil.
Stir-fry for a few more minutes and serve hot.

title: Baked Salmon with Asparagus
ingredients: Salt, pepper, and dill to taste
directions: Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place the salmon fillet and asparagus on a lined baking sheet.
Drizzle olive oil over both and season with salt, pepper, and dill.
Arrange lemon slices over the salmon.
Bake for 12-15 minutes until the salmon is cooked through.

title: Sweet Potato & Black Bean Chili
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
directions: Sauté the chopped onion and minced garlic in a large pot until fragrant.
Add cubed sweet potatoes, black beans, and diced tomatoes to the pot.
Stir in chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook until the sweet potatoes are tender.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.

title: Turkey Lettuce Wraps
directions: Cook the ground turkey in a skillet until browned.
Add diced red bell pepper, shredded carrot, and chopped water chestnuts.
Stir in soy sauce and grated ginger.
Sauté until the vegetables are tender and well mixed with the turkey.
Spoon the mixture into large lettuce leaves and serve immediately.

title: Berry Almond Smoothie Bowl
ingredients: Optional: chia seeds or granola for topping
directions: Blend the mixed berries, banana, almond milk, and almond butter until smooth.
Pour the smoothie into a bowl.
Top with sliced almonds and add chia seeds or granola if desired.
Enjoy immediately for the best texture and flavor.

title: Lentil Soup with Spinach
directions: Rinse the lentils and set them aside.
Sauté chopped onion and minced garlic in a large pot until soft.
Add diced tomatoes and vegetable broth to the pot.
Stir in the lentils, cumin, salt, and pepper, and bring to a simmer.
Once the lentils are tender, add the fresh spinach and cook until wilted.
Serve the soup warm.
